intro: Phebalium salicifolium, commonly known as the willow-leaf hakea, is a shrub native to Western Australia. It features narrow, willow-like leaves that are typically arranged alternately along its stems. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, often appearing in spring. Its botanical characteristics include a woody structure and a preference for well-drained soils. It is often found in coastal and sandy environments, showcasing its adaptability to arid conditions.
